sectiondef.header: XBee configurable I/O pin names. Bitmask applied to certain fields.

briefdescription.para: AD0 (pin 20)
DIO0 (pin 20) - also commissioning button if so configured.
AD1 (pin 19)
DIO1 (pin 19)
AD2 (pin 18)
DIO2 (pin 18)
AD3 (pin 17)
DIO3 (pin 17)
DIO4 (pin 11)
DIO5 (pin 15) - also ASSOC indicator if so configured.
DIO6 (pin 16) - also RTS flow control if so configured.
DIO7 (pin 12) - also CTS flow control if so configured.
Supply voltage sense (in xbee_io_t.analog_enabled field)
DIO10 (pin 6) - also RSSI PWM if so configured.
DIO11 (pin 7)
DIO12 (pin 4) - also CD signal if so configured.
Return code from analog I/O query functions if selected I/O is not valid.
Minimum automatic I/O sample period in ms.
Disabled.
Special function e.g.
Analog input.
Digital input.
Digital output low.
Digital output high.
RS485 transmit enable (act low)
RS485 transmit enable (act high)
Mask for above settings.
OR in to the above to specify automatic sampling when edge detected (ATIC command).
OR in to the above to specify pull-up resistor active (ATPR command).
OR in to the above to specify pull-down resistor active (reserved for future hardware).
OR in to the above to force transmit to the device (else only transmits if changed from last known state)
Configuration type for XBee built-in I/Os.

detaileddescription.para: Follows encoding in ATD0 etc., but also add pullup state as bit encoding.

briefdescription.para: Low (0V)
High (Vcc)
Digital output state for XBee built-in I/Os configured as outputs.
XBEE_FRAME_IO_RESPONSE (0x92)
ATSH and ATSL of sender.
ATMY value of sender.
Currently always 1.
First of variable amount of data Parse using xbee_io_response_parse()
Parse an I/O response and store it in an xbee_io_t structure.

parameterdescription.para: Result structure #param[in] source Pointer to the start of the data i.e. the num_samples field of the I/O response.

briefdescription.para: Debugging function used to dump an xbee_io_t structure to stdout.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to an xbee_io_t structure as set up by xbee_io_response_parse()

briefdescription.para: Return state of a digital input.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to an xbee_io_t structure as set up by xbee_io_response_parse()
digital input number e.g. 0 for DIO0, 12 for DIO12.
Input low
Input high
Input unknown because not configured as a digital input, or is a non-existent input index.

briefdescription.para: Return state of a digital output.

detaileddescription.para: This is a shadow state i.e. the last known state setting.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to an xbee_io_t structure as set up by xbee_io_query()
digital output number e.g. 0 for DIO0, 2 for DIO2.
Output low
Output high
Output unknown because not configured as a digital output, or is a non-existent output index.

briefdescription.para: Return reading of an analog input.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to an xbee_io_t structure as set up by xbee_io_response_parse()
analog input number e.g. 0 for AD0, 2 for AD2, 7 for Vcc reading (where available)

raw single-ended analog reading, normalized to the range 0..32767. Current hardware supports 10-bit ADCs, hence the 5 LSBs will be zero. Future hardware with higher resolution ADCs will add precision to the LSBs.
raw differential analog reading, normalized to the range -16384..16383. This is reserved for future hardware.
Output unknown because not configured as an analog input, or is a non-existent input index.

memberdef.argsstring: (xbee_dev_t *xbee, xbee_io_t FAR *io, uint_fast8_t index, enum xbee_io_digital_output_state state, const wpan_address_t FAR *address)
memberdef.name: xbee_io_set_digital_output

briefdescription.para: Set state of a digital output.

detaileddescription.para: This modifies the shadow state in the io parameter, as well as sending the appropriate configuration command to the target device. If the new state is the same as the shadow state, then the function returns without doing anything, unless XBEE_IO_FORCE is specified in the state parameter.

parameterdescription.para: local device through which to action the request
pointer to an xbee_io_t structure as set up by xbee_io_query(). Shadow state of I/O may be modified
digital output number e.g. 0 for DIO0, 2 for DIO2.

new state of I/O. If the XBEE_IO_FORCE flag is ORed in, then force a state update to the device, whether or not configured as an input or with shadow state unchanged. This can be used to initially configure and set a digital output. Otherwise, a state change will only be sent to the device if the shadow (i.e. last known) state is opposite AND the I/O is configured as a digital output.
NULL for local XBee, or destination IEEE (64-bit) or network (16 bit) address of a remote device. See wpan_envelope_create() for use of IEEE and network addressing.
Output low
Output high
Output unknown because not configured as a digital output (and force was not specified), or is a non-existent output index, or bad parameter passed.
Other negative value indicates problem transmitting the configuration request.

memberdef.argsstring: (xbee_dev_t *xbee, xbee_io_t FAR *io, uint_fast8_t index, enum xbee_io_type type, const wpan_address_t FAR *address)
memberdef.name: xbee_io_configure

briefdescription.para: Configure XBee digital and analog I/Os.

detaileddescription.para: This modifies the shadow state in the io parameter, as well as sending the appropriate configuration command to the target device. If the new state is the same as the shadow state, then the function returns without doing anything, unless XBEE_IO_FORCE is specified in the type parameter.

parameterdescription.para: local device through which to action the request
pointer to an xbee_io_t structure as set up by xbee_io_query(). Shadow state of I/O may be modified
digital or analog I/O number e.g. 0 for DIO0 or AD0.

type of I/O to configure. If the XBEE_IO_FORCE flag is ORed in, force a configuration update to the device. Otherwise, a configuration change will only be sent to the device if the shadow (i.e. last known) configuration is different.
NULL for local XBee, or destination IEEE (64-bit) or network (16 bit) address of a remote device.
Success
Specified I/O index does not exist, or bad parameter.
the AT command table is full (increase the compile-time macro XBEE_CMD_REQUEST_TABLESIZE)
Specified I/O cannot be configured as requested because the hardware or firmware does not support it.
Other negative value indicates problem transmitting the configuration request.

memberdef.argsstring: (xbee_dev_t *xbee, xbee_io_t FAR *io, uint16_t sample_rate, uint16_t change_mask, const wpan_address_t FAR *address)
memberdef.name: xbee_io_set_options

briefdescription.para: Configure XBee automatic I/O sampling options.

detaileddescription.para: This basically controls the ATIR and ATIC settings. IR specifies an automatic sampling interval, and IC specifies sampling on digital I/O change.

parameterdescription.para: local device through which to action the request
pointer to an xbee_io_t structure as set up by xbee_io_query(). Shadow state of I/O may be modified
sample period in ms. 0 to turn off sampling, otherwise must be a value geater than XBEE_IO_MIN_SAMPLE_PERIOD (50 ms with current hardware).
bitmask of I/Os which are to generate samples when their state changes. Construct from ORed combination of XBEE_IO_DIO0, XBEE_IO_DIO1 etc.
NULL for local XBee, or destination IEEE (64-bit) or network (16 bit) address of a remote device.
Success
Bad parameter.
Specified sampling rate or I/O bitmask not supported.
Other negative value indicates problem transmitting the configuration request.

briefdescription.para: Check the status of querying an XBee device, as initiated by xbee_io_query().

parameterdescription.para: I/O query to check (pointer as passed to xbee_io_query()).
query completed
io is NULL
query underway
query timed out
halted, but query may not have completed (unexpected response)

briefdescription.para: Header for code related to built-in I/Os on the XBee module (the ATIS command, 0x92 frames)
